conclusion: To determine heat absorption or release, analyze the Stirling cycle processes in the p-V diagram.
A→B is an isothermal process where temperature remains constant.
In an isothermal process, work done by the gas is given by W = nRT ln(Vf/Vi).
C→D is also an isothermal process.
Work done in isothermal process C→D is W = nRT ln(Vf/Vi).
Work done by the gas in process A→B is W_AB = nRT ln(V_B/V_A).
Work done by the gas in process C→D is W_CD = nRT ln(V_D/V_C).
Total work done in the Stirling cycle is zero since it is a closed loop.
W_AB + W_BC + W_CD + W_DA = 0 in the Stirling cycle.
Processes B→C and D→A are not specified as isothermal.
Understand heat transfer direction in isothermal processes A→B and C→D.
In isothermal process A→B, ΔU = 0 since temperature is constant.
By first law of thermodynamics, Q = W + ΔU.
Since ΔU = 0, Q = W_AB in process A→B.
Work is positive in process A→B, indicating heat absorbed by gas is positive.
Gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
